content.description: At time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, <math alttext="0 is less than t, which is less than 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>, the velocity of a particle moving along the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="v of t, equals, t times the sine of, open parenthesis, t cubed, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo>‚Å°</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>. Let <math alttext="t equals b" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></math> be the time at which the particle changes direction from moving left to moving right.
content.question: What is the total distance traveled by the particle during the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than t, which is less than b" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo><</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo><</mo> <mi>b</mi> </mrow> </math> ?
